let.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: to allow someone to do something
let.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: I can’t come out tonight – my dad won’t let me.
Let Johnny have a go on the computer now.
Some people seem to let their kids do whatever they like.
Let me have a look at that letter.
I can let you have another £10, but no more.
let.translation[0].definitions[0].note_b: In written English, people often prefer to use allow somebody to do something rather than let somebody do something, as it is slightly more formal:
We must allow young people to develop independence.
let.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to not stop something happening, or to make it possible for it to happen
let.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Jenny let the note fall to the ground.
Don’t let anyone know it was me who told you.
Max let the door swing open.
Let the cookies cool down before you try them.
I stupidly let myself be persuaded to take part in a live debate.
let.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: used to make a suggestion or to offer help
let.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Let’s hope he got your message in time.
Let’s make a start, shall we?
Let’s all get together over Christmas.
Let’s not jump to conclusions – he might have been delayed.
Let me help you with those bags.
Let me give you a piece of advice.
let.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: used to say that you wish or hope that something happens, or does not happen
let.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: Don’t let him be the one who died, she prayed.
let.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: to charge someone an amount of money for the use of a room or building
let.translation[0].definitions[4].note.t: To Let written (=written on a sign outside a building to show that it is available for renting)
let.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: Interhome has over 20,000 houses to let across Europe.
I’ve let my spare room to a student.
Would you consider letting me the garage for a few months?
We let the smaller studios out to local artists.
let.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: an arrangement in which a house or flat is rented to someone
let.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: An agency is managing the let.
let.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: to allow someone to use a room or building in return for rent
let.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: There are numerous offices to let (=available to be rented) in the town.
Once the tourist season begins, we should be able to let out the rest of our properties.
She let the studio to artists.
